org.openimaj.content.animation.animator

Class LinearFloatValueAnimator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.content.animation.animator.AbstractValueAnimator<Float>
      • org.openimaj.content.animation.animator.LinearFloatValueAnimator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ReversableValueAnimator<Float>, ValueAnimator<Float>

    public class LinearFloatValueAnimator
extends AbstractValueAnimator<Float>
implements ReversableValueAnimator<Float>
    A ValueAnimator that linearly animates a Float value between two values.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LinearFloatValueAnimator(float start, float finish, int duration)
      Construct a LinearFloatValueAnimator with the given start and finish values, and the given duration in ticks (number of calls to AbstractValueAnimator.nextValue().
      LinearFloatValueAnimator(int startWait, int stopWait, float start, float finish, int duration)
      Construct a LinearFloatValueAnimator with the given start and finish values, and the given duration in ticks (number of calls to AbstractValueAnimator.nextValue().

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected boolean complete() 
      Float makeNextValue() 
      protected void resetToInitial() 
      ReversableValueAnimator<Float> reverseAnimator()
      Reverse the animator and return it, or make a new animator with the same state as this animator, but reversed direction.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LinearFloatValueAnimator

        public LinearFloatValueAnimator(float start,
                                float finish,
                                int duration)
        Construct a LinearFloatValueAnimator with the given start and finish values, and the given duration in ticks (number of calls to AbstractValueAnimator.nextValue(). The animation starts immediately and completes once duration ticks have been reached.
        Parameters:
        start - start value
        finish - stop value
        duration -

      • LinearFloatValueAnimator

        public LinearFloatValueAnimator(int startWait,
                                int stopWait,
                                float start,
                                float finish,
                                int duration)
        Construct a LinearFloatValueAnimator with the given start and finish values, and the given duration in ticks (number of calls to AbstractValueAnimator.nextValue(). The animation will start after startWait ticks, and finish stopWait ticks after startWait+duration.
        Parameters:
        startWait - amount of time in ticks to wait before starting animation.
        stopWait - amount of time in ticks to wait after finishing animation.
        start - start value
        finish - stop value
        duration -

        public ReversableValueAnimator<Float> reverseAnimator()
        Description copied from interface: ReversableValueAnimator
        Reverse the animator and return it, or make a new animator with the same state as this animator, but reversed direction.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        reversed animator.
